title: 18 Lesser-Known (Yet Powerful) Ahrefs Hacks
description: Check out these 18 lesser-known use cases to help you get everything out of Ahrefs and enhance your SEO efforts.
content: Andrei »öi»õ Showing you how to make the most out of Ahrefs. Mostly through: how-to videos, product updates, webinars, and brochures. Get the week's best marketing content Email Subscription Subscribe Leave this field empty if you're human: Contents Even if you‚Äôre familiar with Ahrefs, you probably use one or two tools on a daily basis. But there are more you‚Äôre missing out on.To help you get the most out of Ahrefs, we‚Äôve put together 18 lesser-known use cases that can immediately enhance your SEO efforts.Contents1. Browse the most popular search queries in each countryAre you wondering what people around the world are searching for the most?Run an empty search in Ahrefs‚Äô Keywords Explorer and gain access to 19.2 billion keywords across 200+ countries and regions. The U.S. keyword database alone counts ~4.5 billion keywords (the largest one in the whole industry).From here, you can use a couple of filters to find high-volume, low-competition keywords in a matter of seconds.For example, let‚Äôs search for topics with these:Keyword Difficulty: up to 20Search volume: between 5,000 and 10,000 visits/monthWord count: max. 3 wordsOnce we‚Äôve done so, our list is narrowed down to ~198,000 lucrative keywords. Rinse and repeat for your target country.2. Find out if you can target multiple keywords with one pageLet‚Äôs say you have the following keywords:They seem to be the same topic. But how do you know whether you should target them with a single page or create separate pages?We can find out by checking whether Google ranks similar search results for them.There are two easy ways to see how their SERPs overlap:A. Put the keywords in Keywords Explorer and go to the Traffic share by pages report.B. Use the SERP comparison tool under the SERP overview.It looks like the top-ranking pages for both keywords are nearly identical (7/10 common results). Something also indicated by our SERP similarity score.This likely means that Google sees ‚Äúwhipped coffee recipe‚Äù as a subtopic of a more general query, ‚Äúwhipped coffee.‚Äù Which means you can likely rank for both keywords with a single page.3. Monitor the pace at which your competitors release contentIf your competitors publish a ton of content frequently, it may be difficult to compete with them.You can find out if that is the case by using the Top pages report in Site Explorer, which shows pages that rank for at least one keyword in the top 100. First, (1) filter for newly created pages, then (2) use the comparison mode to compare the current output of ranking pages with, say, the one from three months ago.By following these exact steps, it looks like our content writers have created over 200 pages for the Ahrefs Blog in the past three months.You can also consider using this as an argument to ask for a budget raise and build a larger content team.4. Look for higher-quality backlinksIf you‚Äôre a link builder, one of your main strategies is likely to reverse engineer your competitors‚Äô link building tactics.Rather than going through every backlink your competitor has, you can get quicker wins by filtering the backlinks by domain traffic. This surfaces higher-quality backlinks.For example, there are 760 links pointing at HubSpot‚Äôs #1 result for the keyword ‚Äúseo tools‚Äù:We have a post targeting the same topic ranking #3. If we want to rank higher on Google, we can prioritize our link building efforts by reaching out only to the websites that get at least 5,000 search visits per month. This gives us a manageable list of 90 websites. 5. Find podcasts to be a guest onPodcasts are a great way to build both backlinks and authority in your industry. To find potential podcasts to be interviewed on, enter the Twitter URL of a regular podcast guest in your industry. We‚Äôre using Twitter profiles because the host usually links to a guest‚Äôs social accounts.For example, Rand Fishkin is a popular marketer and entrepreneur who has been featured on many podcasts. So I‚Äôll paste his Twitter profile URL into Site Explorer and head to the Backlinks report. To narrow in only on podcasts, set a filter to show referring page titles that contain words like ‚Äúepisode‚Äù or ‚Äúpodcast.‚Äù And right away, we‚Äôve found over 160 podcasts!Repeat this for other regular podcast interviewees in your industry and find tons of podcasts to pitch yourself to.6. Find resource pages to get featured onThanks to its simplicity and scalability, resource page link building is still one of the most popular link building tactics.The tactic works by acquiring backlinks from webpages that curate useful industry resources. And what better way to find them than to look at what resource pages your competitor has links to?For example, let‚Äôs check moz.com‚Äôs backlink profile under the Backlinks report. But this time, I will filter for the referring page URLs that contain ‚Äúresources.html‚Äù and ‚Äúresources.php.‚ÄùHere, we have 250 links; we can potentially reach out to their site owners and request them to include Ahrefs as a resource.Further readingResource Page Link Building: The Only Guide You Need7. Discover where the bulk of your competitors‚Äô search traffic is coming fromGain valuable insights on what pages (product, category, tool, etc.) bring the most organic traffic to your competitors.Use the Organic pages by traffic chart under Overview 2.0 to see pages distributed by their organic search traffic.For example, six pages are responsible for almost 25% of the traffic coming to Ahrefs‚Äô blog. If you were a direct competitor, you could potentially compete with us and replicate those pages.8. Find low-competition topics with high traffic potentialLow-competition topics with high traffic potential are the dream of every content marketer (especially those in saturated markets). But how can you discover such low-hanging fruits?Just open Ahrefs‚Äô Content Explorer, search for a broad topic like ‚Äúbackpacking,‚Äù and apply these two filters:Referring domains: Up to 5Page traffic: At least 1,000This gives me a list of relevant pages that get lots of organic traffic and are easy to rank for.From here, you can dig further into the keywords driving the organic traffic and fill your content calendar for months to come.TipYou can also find low-competition keywords with high traffic potential by going to the Top pages report under Site Explorer and setting a maximum KD filter of 20.9. Find video topics to rank on GoogleTo get more views for your videos and improve their rankings on Google, the key is to target topics with video intent. If Google is showing videos for a particular search query, it means searchers prefer to watch a video rather than read.To find such topics, open Content Explorer and paste the following query:site:youtube.com inurl:watch title:[your topic]We‚Äôll go for ‚Äúmakeup.‚Äù From here, sort the pages by Page traffic and find video topics with traffic potential.NotePay close attention to page traffic numbers, as some of them might be cached. In such cases, look at the organic traffic trends instead to check the consistency of the traffic over longer periods of time (6+ months).What‚Äôs left is to check the keywords the page ranks for to get guidance on both on-page and video optimizations.10. Get internal linking suggestionsMost SEOs sleep on internal linking and fail to realize what a valuable tactic it is.Perhaps, its most noticeable benefit among numerous ones‚Äîfrom helping Google discover your pages to passing link equity‚Äîis that you control the target location of the link itself.But finding potential internal linking opportunities is time consuming. Wouldn‚Äôt it be great to get internal linking suggestions on autopilot? You can, thanks to Ahrefs‚Äô Site Audit. Run a site crawl, and the Internal link opportunities report will identify internal link opportunities by taking the top 10 keywords for your ranking pages‚Äîthen find mentions of them on your other pages. This includes important keyword metrics and the keyword context.We won‚Äôt suggest a link if one already exists between the pages. Further readingInternal Links for SEO: An Actionable GuideHere‚Äôs Why You Should Prioritize Internal Link Building11. Discover local citation opportunitiesA good practice to improve your local SEO is to get local citations. Those are mentions of your business‚Äôs name, address, or phone number on popular directories that help searchers find your business online.To find them, check the directories where your competitors‚Äô business profiles are mentioned.Let‚Äôs say we own a plumbing company in Toronto. If you already know your competition (if not, Google your niche followed by the city you live in), go to Site Explorer and open the Link Intersect report.Paste your competitors‚Äô websites in the top section and yours at the bottom. Next set the target mode to URL mode, since citations usually point to a homepage.This will show you all the websites that link to your competitors‚Äô URLs, but not to yours. Usually, the more targets the referring domains are linking to, the more likely it‚Äôs a business directory. As is the case with websites.ca.Next, reach out to them.Further readingHow to Build Local Citations (Complete Guide)Local SEO: The Complete Guide12. Find missed keyword opportunities Missed keyword opportunities are those keywords where your competitors rank for, but you don‚Äôt.To increase your chances of ranking higher in search results, you need to close this content gap between you and the top-ranking pages (aka your organic search competitors).To do so, open Ahrefs‚Äô Keywords Explorer and search for a keyword that you know you don‚Äôt rank for in the top three. For us, this would be ‚Äúaffiliate marketing,‚Äù as seen in the SERP overview below.Next, select all the top-ranking pages that are relevant pages to yours (meaning they serve the same search intent) and send them to our Content Gap tool. This should give you a list of lucrative keywords that your website should be ranking for.And we‚Äôve got ~1,550 keywords that we can potentially target in our affiliate marketing post.13. Analyze which subfolders drive the most organic trafficThe Site structure report under Site Explorer breaks down a website‚Äôs structure into a tree-like format to help you make useful discoveries.For example, three of our translated blogs (Italian, German, Spanish) generate almost as much traffic as our top blog article in English.You can go one step further and select the Columns dropdown to include certain metrics, like paid ones, which will lead to further discoveries.Let‚Äôs go this time with monday.com. If we compare the paid metrics with those from three months ago, we can actually monitor the ad spend over time for each top folder.It looks like most of the ad spend went toward the blog, particularly the ‚Äútask management‚Äù subfolder.14. Find featured snippet opportunitiesThe best way to shortcut your way to the top position in Google without building backlinks is to find featured snippet opportunities.To increase your chances of ranking for them, open the Organic keywords report under Site Explorer and filter for organic keywords in positions 2‚Äì8. Then check the filter ‚ÄúSERP features: where target doesn‚Äôt rank for.‚ÄùFor the Ahrefs Blog, there are 4,803 keywords with high chances of ranking for a featured snippet‚Äîwhich requires less effort than ranking at position #1.Further readingGoogle‚Äôs Featured Snippets: All You Need to Know to Get Them15. Reveal affiliates for a productIf you‚Äôre looking for affiliates, this is for you. This works best when you know the affiliate URL for a product. Most affiliate links have a ‚Äú?‚Äù followed by the vendor‚Äôs ID, which may or may not be repeatable. If you already know it, (1) paste the repeating part of it into Site Explorer in the Path mode, (2) go to the Backlinks report, and (3) sort by Page traffic.In return, you‚Äôll get the top SEO affiliates for a given product. If you were a competitor of this product, you might increase your reach by partnering with them.16. Discover keywords that rank with a page that has few referring domainsWhat if you could discover outlier keywords that rank in the top five or top 10 with a page that has few referring domains?This means that if you already have a website with higher authority, you can (in theory) easily outrank them.To find such links, search for a keyword with high business potential in Keywords Explorer and open the Matching terms report. I‚Äôll go with ‚Äúaffiliate marketing.‚ÄùThen apply the Lowest DR filter to ‚ÄúUp to 50 in top 5.‚ÄùWith these filters, we‚Äôre specifically looking for outlier pages that are ranking for a competitive keyword despite a lower website authority.For example, we‚Äôve found a listicle from breezy.io ranking #1 for ‚Äúaffiliate marketing‚Äù with only 11 referring domains and a DR of 38.17. Build links with imagesIf you‚Äôve created unique images for your website (charts, graphs, infographics), chances are people are linking to them and not to the pages where they were initially featured.To find and claim improper image attributions, enter your website into Site Explorer and head over to the Backlinks report. Then search for .PNG or .JPG in the ‚ÄúTarget URL‚Äù filter.Further readingImage SEO: 12 Actionable Tips (For More Organic Traffic)18. Find broken link building opportunitiesBroken link building involves finding a dead page with lots of backlinks and asking those linking to the page to swap the link to one of your website‚Äôs pages.To put this tactic to work:Check the Best by links report under Site Explorer for your competitor‚Äôs websiteSet the ‚ÄúHTTP code‚Äù filter to 404 Not foundSort by Referring domainsFor example, if you are a competitor of Canva (the design tool), you can potentially create a better resource for ‚Äúzoom virtual backgrounds‚Äù or ‚Äúresumes.‚ÄùAfter you‚Äôve created the content, you can ask linkers to the broken page to link to you instead.Further readingBroken Link Building: The Complete GuideFinal thoughtsWithout doubt, you can do even more with Ahrefs. But these handy use cases should help you crush your SEO tasks with less effort.Have more Ahrefs hacks to share with us?
